text: ãã—ã¦ job_start ã‚’ãã®ã¾ã¾ã§ã¯ãªã System.Job ã‚’ä½¿ã†ã“ã¨ã§ Neovim ã«ã‚‚å¯¾å¿œã§ãã¾ã™

```
call l:promise.new({ resolve -> job_start(cmd, {
      \ 'out_cb': { job, msg -> execute('echomsg msg', '') },
      \ 'err_cb': { job, msg -> execute('echomsg msg', '') },
      \ 'exit_cb': { job, exit_status -> resolve(exit_status) },
      \ })
      \})
      \.then({ exit_status -> execute('echomsg "exit: " . exit_status', '') })
      \.catch({ exc -> execute('echomsg string(exc)', '') })
      \.finally({ -> delete(tags_lock_path) })
```

```
let s:Promise = vital#vital#import('Async.Promise')

function! s:test() abort
  let cmd = ["date"]

  call s:Promise.new({ resolve -> job_start(cmd, {
        \ 'out_cb': { job, msg -> execute('echomsg "stdout:" . msg', '') },
        \ 'err_cb': { job, msg -> execute('echomsg "stderr:" . msg', '') },
        \ 'exit_cb': { job, exit_status -> resolve(exit_status) },
        \ })
        \})
        \.then({ exit_status -> execute('echomsg "exit: " . exit_status', '') })
        \.catch({ exc -> execute('echomsg string(exc)', '') })
        \.finally({ -> execute('echomsg "finally"') })
endfunction


call s:test()
```

```

"test.vim" 18L, 622C
stdout:Thu May 31 23:01:18 JST 2018
exit: 0
```

ã‚ãƒ¼ã§ã¯ `join(cmd, ' ')` ã‚’æ¸¡ã›ã°è‰¯ã„ã‹ãªã€‚ãŸã—ã‹ Vim ã® `job_start` ã¯æ–‡å­—åˆ—ã§ã‚‚å¤§ä¸ˆå¤«ã ã£ãŸæ°—ãŒã—ã¾ã™

> {command} can be a String.  This works best on MS-Windows.  On
> Unix it is split up in white-separated parts to be passed to
> execvp().  Arguments in double quotes can contain white space.
